info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 01 at 2:15AM PST until January 04 at 12:00AM PST by NWS Sacramento
info.description: ...Winter weather returns early next week... .Another weather system will bring snow to the mountains of interior NorCal early next week. At this point, it looks like the heaviest snow will occur over the foothills and mountains to the north of Redding late Sunday night into Monday evening. Significant travel impacts will be possible on Interstate 5 north of Redding. Elsewhere, lighter snowfall accumulations may impact travel over the southern Cascade and northern Sierra passes on Monday. If you`re planning travel over the mountains early next week, stay in touch with the latest forecasts. ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY EVENING ABOVE 1500 FEET... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Plan on difficult travel conditions. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 8 inches above 1500 feet, with 10 to 20 inches above 3000 feet, are possible. * WHERE...Shasta Lake Area / Northern Shasta County including Interstate 5 north of Redding. * WHEN...From late Sunday night through Monday evening. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Significant reductions in visibility are possible. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... A Winter Storm Watch means there is potential for significant snow, sleet or ice accumulations that may impact travel. Continue to monitor the latest forecasts.
